Subject: How to uninstall DLP via SCCM or commandline
Description: Hello, We're trying to uninstall DLP agent on some clients, but there is no documentation about this. Could you please provide help how to do this in SCCM or the proper command-line for this? I already tried these commands, but none worked: MsiExec.exe /x "{1529C7BD-20E9-4110-A11A-7243A1A4EBD3}" /qn PASSWORD="YourUninstallPassword" MsiExec.exe /x "{1529C7BD-20E9-4110-A11A-7243A1A4EBD3}" /quiet PASSWORD="YourUninstallPassword" Start-Process -FilePath "MsiExec.exe" -ArgumentList "/x '{1529C7BD-20E9-4110-A11A-7243A1A4EBD3}' /quiet PASSWORD='YourUninstallPassword'"
What_We_Know__c: Customer request documentation on the uninstallation of EPP client.  We provided a link to our user manual article on "Client Software" to the customer as well as provided a script for uninstallation together with a step by step guide and a video recording on how to perform the procedure.
Next_Steps__c:
Customer to perform procedure provided and follow the step by step guide and then provide us with feedback on results.

2025.04.11 - Customer confirmed that issue is resolved and confirmed that case can be closed.
Solution_Comment__c: 2025.04.11 - Customer confirmed that issue is resolved and confirmed that case can be closed.
